001package imagingbook.common.util.parameters;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
004import java.io.PrintStream;
005import java.lang.reflect.Field;
006import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
007
008import imagingbook.common.util.ObjectUtils;
009
010
011/**
012 * Interface to be implemented by local 'Parameters' classes. This is part of
013 * the 'simple parameter object' scheme, working with public fields. Only
014 * non-static, non-final, public fields are accepted as parameters.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2022/02/02
018 * @version 2022/09/13 moved dialog-related methods to {@link DialogParameterBundle}
019 */
020public interface ParameterBundle {
021        
022        default String printToString() {
023                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
024                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
025                        printToStream(strm);
026                }
027                return bas.toString();
028        }
029
030        default void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
031                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
032                if (!Modifier.isPublic(clazz.getModifiers())) {
033                        strm.print("[WARNING] class " + clazz.getSimpleName() + " should be declared public or protected!\n");
034                }
035                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
036//              strm.println(clazz.getCanonicalName());
037                for (Field field : fields) {
038//                      if (!isValidParameterItem(field)) {
039//                              continue;
040//                      }
041                        strm.print(field.getType().getSimpleName() + " ");
042                        strm.print(field.getName() + " = ");
043                        try {
044                                strm.print(field.get(this).toString());
045                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
046                                strm.print("FIELD VALUE UNREADABLE!");
047                        }       
048                        strm.println();
049//                      int modifiers = field.getModifiers();
050//                      strm.println("Field is public = " + Modifier.isPublic(modifiers));
051//                      strm.println("Field is final = " + Modifier.isFinal(modifiers));
052                }
053        }
054        
055        /**
056         * Validates the correctness and compatibility of the
057         * parameters in this bundle. 
058         * Implementing classes should override this method.
059         * 
060         * @return true if all parameters are OK, false otherwise
061         */
062        default boolean validate() {
063                return true;
064        }
065        
066
067
068//      static void printModifiers(Field f) {
069//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
070//              System.out.println("Modifiers of field " + f.getName());
071//              System.out.println("abstract     = " + Modifier.isAbstract(mod));
072//              System.out.println("final        = " + Modifier.isFinal(mod));
073//              System.out.println("interface    = " + Modifier.isInterface(mod));
074//              System.out.println("native       = " + Modifier.isNative(mod));
075//              System.out.println("private      = " + Modifier.isPrivate(mod));
076//              System.out.println("protected    = " + Modifier.isProtected(mod));
077//              System.out.println("public       = " + Modifier.isPublic(mod));
078//              System.out.println("static       = " + Modifier.isStatic(mod));
079//              System.out.println("strict       = " + Modifier.isStrict(mod));
080//              System.out.println("synchronized = " + Modifier.isSynchronized(mod));
081//              System.out.println("transient    = " + Modifier.isTransient(mod));
082//              System.out.println("volatite     = " + Modifier.isVolatile(mod));
083//      }
084
085        
086        /**
087         * Returns a shallow copy of the specified {@link DialogParameterBundle}
088         * instance.
089         * 
090         * @param <T> generic type
091         * @param params a {@link DialogParameterBundle} instance
092         * @return a copy with the same type, fields and values as the original instance
093         */
094        public static <T extends DialogParameterBundle> T duplicate(T params) {
095            return ObjectUtils.copy(params);
096        }
097
098        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
099        
100
101
102//      /**
103//       * Example parameter bundle
104//       */
105//      static class DemoParameters implements ParameterBundle {
106//              public static int staticInt = 44;       // currently static members are listed too!
107//              
108//              @DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
109//              public boolean someBool = true;
110//              public int someInt = 39;
111//              public float someFloat = 1.99f;
112//              
113//              @DialogLabel("Math.PI")@DialogDigits(10)
114//              public double someDouble = Math.PI;
115//              public String someString = "SHOW ME";
116//              
117//              @DialogHide
118//              public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
119//              public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
120//      }
121//      
122
123        
124}
